article.headline: St. John's 86, Niagara 64
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Avery Patterson recorded a career-high 26 points Saturday to lead St. John's to an 86-64 win over Niagara. Patterson went 8-of-15 from the field, connecting on 6-of-13 3-point attempts and was 4-of-4 from the foul line while grabbing seven rebounds. Anthony Mason Jr. also scored a career-high 22 points while tying his career mark with 11 rebounds for St. John's (6-3), while Eugene Lawrence grabbed 6 rebounds and scored 14 points. St. John's, in extending its winning streak to four games, recorded its highest points-total of the season while also recording season highs in field goals made (31) and rebounds (41). The Red Storm shot 57.4 percent from the field while holding Niagara to just 32.8 percent (21-of-64). Clif Brown led Niagara (1-6) with 23 points, 20 of them in the first half. But Brown was just 1-of-8 in the second half. The Purple Eagles shot 7-for-32 in the second half and 3-for-14 from beyond the 3-point arc in the half, 9-for-27 for the game. Tyrone Lewis also had 10 points for Niagara. St. John's took a 41-36 lead at halftime, limiting Niagara's chances on the boards by holding a 41-32 advantage in rebounds, outscoring the Purple Eagles in the paint (38-20).

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
